```{r in-line code q21a}
# total respondents ----
q21a_num_answers <- meds2024_before_clean |> 
  select(spatial_data) |> 
  count() |> 
  pull()

# total not answer 1 ----
q21a_not1 <- meds2024_before_clean |> 
  select(spatial_data) |> 
  group_by(spatial_data) |>
  filter(spatial_data != "1 (never worked with it before)") |> 
  count() |>
  ungroup() |> 
  summarize(n = sum(n)) |> 
  pull()

# answered 1 ----
q21a_1 <- meds2024_before_clean |> 
  select(spatial_data) |> 
  group_by(spatial_data) |>
  filter(spatial_data == "1 (never worked with it before)") |> 
  count() |>
  ungroup() |> 
  summarize(n = sum(n)) |> 
  pull()
```

::: {.callout-note}

**`r q21a_not1` / `r q21a_num_answers` student respondents (`r ((q21a_not1/q21a_num_answers)*100)`%)** chose a familiarity level of 2 or greater -- these respondents were directed to answer Question 21b. `r q21a_1` respondents selected **1 (never worked with it before)** in response to Question 21a and were jumped directly to Question 22 â€“ they are recorded as `NA` in Questions 21b & 21c, below.
